column4: Can anybody help with Natty video trouble on HD6000 series? I'm at my wits' end...
what card specifically are you using?
I think it's a 6850... let me check
and do you know what driver you're running?
it's a 6870, and at the moment i'm on the open source driver
but I can't install the proprietary drivers, because I literally can't get to my desktop.
I don't think the open source driver supports the high-end AMD cards just yet...You may need to use the proprietary driver
I figured as much, and I'm fine with the proprietary driver, but right now I can't even get into my system.
I've had tons of headaches with my own 4870 and drivers...I feel your pain...In the end it was easiest for me to just reinstall the system
I'm guessing you hit a black screen when you try to boot
yeah, that's the trouble -- I'm on my... third clean reinstall, I think?
do you get any video from a clean install? You may need to boot into recovery mode and install fglrx from the command line
Not quite. Grub is fine, I see the ubuntu splash, then when my desktop should pop up I get either a quick flashing screen or a weird color.
how do I do that from GRUB?
you should see an option just below the regular boot mode that has (recovery mode) next to it
thanks!
good luck, hope it works out
also, how do I upgrade an installed driver
you can try the regular sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
I did have a working setup for a time, but tried to install the newest version from AMD and everything was ruined when I uninstalled the old driver
thanks again

I've had similar experiences...what ended up working for me was this: Install Ubuntu, do all the updates you possibly can without touching the video drivers, install the AMD drivers from their site WITHOUT catalyst control center
thank you! I'll give that a shot.
